thread.title: Stenprop eyes JSE move from AltX, CFO says | Property
thread.title_full: Stenprop eyes JSE move from AltX, CFO says | Property | BDlive

author: Alistair Anderson
title: Stenprop eyes JSE move from AltX, CFO says | Property
text:
Picture: THINKSTOCK Related articles Stenprop’s Europe focus reaps reward Stenprop makes first disposals and acquisitions since listing Stenprop reverse lists in GoGlobal ALTX-listed Stenprop, which has a focus on western European assets, still hopes to move to the main board this year.
Chief financial officer Patsy Watson said on Thursday the Western Europe-focused fund was on track to move to the main board by the end of the year with assets worth around R6bn.
The group posted basic earnings attributable to ordinary shareholders for the three month period to June this year of €7,098,805. This equated to a diluted earnings per share of 2.60 cents. The headline earnings were €8,306,922 equating to a diluted headline EPS of 3.04 cents per share.
The listed property sector is SA’s most active on the JSE, with about R20bn having being raised through equity raises year to date.
